Message.Title: Cramer said Friday AMZN should be at $120 using AAPL for comparison
Message.Msg: In a segment AAPL vs AMZN at the end of his show this past Friday, Carmer said, if you use AMZN's valuation AAPL should be at $1200, (which really means AMZN is only worth $120 at this time). He went on to say AMZN gave basically NO information on the conference call and we have no way of knowing if they're doing well or even if they will grow from here, add customers,or add much business....He said the AMZN numbers were bad (losses terrible profit margin) & the AMZN valuation is ridiculous... This is a change after all his AMZN pumping this year.

Message.Title: Kindle fire HD vs Nexus 10
Message.Msg: No comparison. Kindle fire HD 8.9" price 299+15 (remove ad) +10 (power adapter): $325 Nexus 10: $399 Nexus 10 has super screen resolution, 2560*1600 and is over 1" bigger. Nexus 10 has 5-megapixel camera around back and a 1.9-megapixel front-facing camera. Nexus 10 has super fast powerful dual-core ARM Cortex-A15 chip paired with 2GB of RAM. Nexus 10 has a 9,000mAh capacity, which Google says should be good for up to 9 hours of HD video playback. Nexus 10 gives you access to Google Play with so much more apps than amazon market can offer. Why would anyone buy the toy kindle fire?

Topic.Title: Cramer said Friday AMZN should be at $120 using AAPL for comparison

Message.Msg: AMZN has been a great ride but I think we're done. I think Friday is a hangover from the good old days (last week). The earnings were truly frightening and the way forward is missing entirely. I am applying very tight trailubg stops that I expect to trigger this week when we reopen. I won't short because shorting is too risky for me. But I think 2013 is going to be a very tough year for us all and especially for AMZN. I'm not bashing, just being realistic.

Message.Title: Your house is flooded, you have lost everything= let's shop online?
Message.Msg: I don't see a national disaster being good for online retail. I am not expert, but katrina and irene didn't do lots for the consumer side of things. Motley fool, seeking alpha, and cramer all puttin a hit job on this after the price goes hyperbolic on an HFT short squeeze tape paint and two closed stock market days... We will see, clearly the bulls just don't care and will buy this at 10000x pe. Plus the ipad mini is a kindle killer even if the price point is over a hundred bucks higher. Then there is nexus, and ads on kindle which suck. But the stock may go up anway of course. Reality doesn't matter.

Topic.Title: amazon engages in unfair competition

Message.Msg: I began boycotting them months ago. I won't shop there and am going to close my credit card with Amazon. I believe it is an evil company. They plan to slowly annihilate the majority of other retailers, all with the blessings of Wall Street (Besos and Wall Street cronyism at work) to support the stock price in the interum. When they have taken out the majority of the competition they will raise prices exhorbantly higher. I will only shop at stores that actually HIRE people, not robots, provide benefits, are community based, and are competition to Amazon. This is the ONLY way to bring this company to task for it's unfair practices. I keep watching for an investigation into the trading of their stock and/or their accounting. Nothing would be sweeter, imo.

Topic.Title: amazon engages in unfair competition

Message.Msg: Once I accidentally ordered from an EBay vendor at my state and I have to pay state tax after I log into PayPal and saw the tax on the last page of the transaction. People should pay attention not to buy from vendors who are in your state. Call me cheap but I like to save 7% on everything, if not every big ticket item, I buy. I also notice since AMZN switched to central distribution model, most of its marketplace vendors have moved (back) to EBay. And Amazon's prices are now higher than EBAY, even higher than Wal-Mart sometimes. I predict buyers will get smart and avoid AMZN at any cost in the next few months. Right now only fools are buying from Amazon.
